com.camerontec.catalys.server.security.auth.login

Class FixLoginAuthenticationMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.security.auth.login.FixLoginAuthenticationMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFixLoginContextRegistry, ISessionCustomizer, IComponent, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable

    public class FixLoginAuthenticationMonitor
extends ComponentHelper
implements ISessionCustomizer, IFixLoginContextRegistry
    Class which customizes FIX sessions to provide pluggable FIX logon authentication.

    This class uses the ISessionCustomizer.logonAccepted(java.lang.Object, com.camerontec.catalys.core.message.IFIXMessage) hook to trigger authentication for a specific session. Control is then passed to a LoginContext which is responsible for authentication against all of the configured LoginModules associated with the name CONFIG_NAME.

    Once authenticated each FIX session is monitored for its logged on state. If a session goes away then the LoginContext is informed, which again controls any associated tear down.

    It is assumed that suitable Configuration exists and is accessible by the LoginContext.

    See Also:
    Configuration, LoginContext, LoginModule

      • logonAccepted

        public String logonAccepted(Object source,
                            IFIXMessage logonRequest)
        Description copied from interface: ISessionCustomizer
        Called when Session wants to know whether the given Logon request/response should be accepted.

        If any listener returns a non null value, the logon will not be accepted.

        Note that this method is only called for good logon requests - that is there is nothing wrong with the message data itself. You need not validate the data. However, you may wish to reject the request for other reasons.

        Specified by:
        logonAccepted in interface ISessionCustomizer
        Parameters:
        source - Some indication of which session is the source of this event.
        logonRequest - Logon request or response to be accepted or rejected.
        Returns:
        null if accepted, otherwise a String giving the reason for the rejection.

      • customizeLogonResponse

        public void customizeLogonResponse(Object source,
                                   IFIXMessage logonRequest,
                                   IFIXMessage logonResponse)
        Description copied from interface: ISessionCustomizer
        Called by Session in order to allow you to modify the default response to a logon request.

        Each listener may modify the logonResponse so that the final response may have been contributed to by each.

        Note that this method is only called for good logon requests that we are going to accept - as defined by logonAccepted.

        Specified by:
        customizeLogonResponse in interface ISessionCustomizer
        Parameters:
        source - Some indication of which session is the source of this event.
        logonRequest - The logon request that we are responding to.
        logonResponse - The response that will be sent.
        See Also:
        ISessionCustomizer.logonAccepted(java.lang.Object, com.camerontec.catalys.core.message.IFIXMessage)

      • partyAccepted

        public String partyAccepted(Object source,
                            IFIXMessage mess)
        Description copied from interface: ISessionCustomizer
        Called when Session wants to know whether it should communicate with the party associated with the given Message.

        Rejecting the party by returning false is considered a fatal session error. The Session will throw a FatalProtocolException.

        If the party is accepted, that party becomes the party associated with the Session and this method is no longer called.

        If any listener returns non null, the party will not be accepted.

        Note that the parties associated with any message are easily retrieved by calling IFIXMessageSpecifics.getSenderParty() and IFIXMessageSpecifics.getTargetParty().

        Application Note
        This call back is used to identify the party on a Session from the first message they send. This is particularly useful in a server environment where you are listening for FIX sessions which could come from a variety of possible clients.
        Once identified, the party can be used to look up Session configuration information for that party - notably input and output sequence numbers - and communication can recommence from where you last left off with that party. Configuration information will usually be retrieved from the SessionFactory object.
        Any session reconfiguration based on the accepted party should all be performed in this callback. Otherwise, the incoming message may not be processed correctly (usually because its sequence number will not match what the Session is expecting).

        Specified by:
        partyAccepted in interface ISessionCustomizer
        Parameters:
        source - Some indication of which session is the source of this event.
        mess - Message received from other party.
        Returns:
        Null if the Session may communicate with the party. Otherwise return an indication of the problem.

      • shouldResend

        public boolean shouldResend(Object source,
                            IFIXMessage mess)
        Description copied from interface: ISessionCustomizer
        Called when Session wants to know whether given message should be resent.

        An example of a message that you may not want to resend might be a new order message whose price is no longer in line with the current market price.

        If any listener returns false, message will not be resent.

        Specified by:
        shouldResend in interface ISessionCustomizer
        Parameters:
        source - Some indication of which session is the source of this event.
        mess - The message which we want to know whether to resend
        Returns:
        True if message should be resent
